docs.lead_paragraph: Howard Hirsch of New York and his wife and baby live in a boat that sank in Manhasset Bay.

headline.main: Family's Dreams Come True on a Boat Raised From the Depths; Raising Sunken Hulk on L.I. Opens Way to a New Life The Hirsches Thrive in Europe's Waters With Rebuilt Yacht

docs.abstract: boat owners reactions to NYS law prohibiting them from discharging wastes into waters and problem of installing proper holding tanks discussed; unanswerable questions pertaining to out-of-state boat owners, enforcement, and new and cheaper devices noted; Sen Boggs hints that long-delayed Fed legis on boat pollution may be forwarded to Cong this wk; compromise version expected to supersede state laws and place burden of proof on state to show necessity for having no-discharge policy
docs.snippet: Howard Hirsch of New York and his wife and baby live in a boat that sank in Manhasset Bay.
